p: Like M. pneumoniae P1 and P30, M. synoviae variable lipoprotein hemagglutinin (VlhA) can also bind to sialylated molecules [ 68]. The most important characteristic of this VlhA-sialylated molecule binding process is the presence of sialoreceptor binding motif P-X-(BCAA)-X-F-X-(BCAA)-X-A-K-X-G in sialylated receptors [ 68], indicating that this distinct motif might help identify hypothetical adhesins and their sialoreceptors.
